channel.title: Timer
channel.description: okai so on my armor tab theres a donator option next to the stats and items on death.... if u click the donator thing it gives u a restore spec optiion how do i add a timer on it so u can only use ever 5 mins?

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

strucker:

you’re an idiot. L0L

Correction, you’re an idiot. Not everybody learns as fast as fast as you or somebody else, especially with with such a poor explanation like the one provided above. In the future try elaborating a little more on the topic and don’t jump to such brash derogatory conclusions that people are idiots because they don’t understand a concept. Here’s a prime example: this topic. You didn’t understand what that error meant, you had to learn as well as the OP has to learn to use timers. doesn’t feel so great does it?

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @RebirthScape RebirthScape
item.description:
@RebirthScape wrote:

[quote=“strucker, post:2, topic:449320”]Read about timers. they’re pretty easy to use
you have two options. get an event manager.
or use this:

add these imports

import java.util.Timer; import java.util.TimerTask;

use like this

[code] public void demoDelayedTask() {
Timer timer = new Timer();
int delayTime = 2000; // Milliseconds to wait before running delayed task

            timer.schedule(new TimerTask() {
                    @Override
                    public void run() {
				
                            System.out.println("Delayed task has been run.");
                            System.out.println("Current time: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
                    }                        
            }, delayTime);
    }[/code]

also you may want to take a look at
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/misc/timer.html[/quote]

Ohh…That’s cool! I’ve seen those timer things a lot, thanks man…This is good.

Read full topic

item.title: Timer
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

Read about timers. they’re pretty easy to use
you have two options. get an event manager.
or use this:

add these imports

import java.util.Timer; import java.util.TimerTask;

use like this

[code] public void demoDelayedTask() {
Timer timer = new Timer();
int delayTime = 2000; // Milliseconds to wait before running delayed task

            timer.schedule(new TimerTask() {
                    @Override
                    public void run() {
				
                            System.out.println("Delayed task has been run.");
                            System.out.println("Current time: " + System.currentTimeMillis());
                    }                        
            }, delayTime);
    }[/code]

also you may want to take a look at
http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/misc/timer.html
